/*
********************************************************************************************************
The first sql select will get the table names.
the second sql will get the max ordinal. This is to check if there are multiple columns that make up
a unique row. In the case of CODETABLEITEM there are 3. I only want to process on row. If there is
one row the column is use in as the Key Identifier in the data flow.
If the Ordinal Position is greater than 1 it is the CODETABLEITEM. Then that data is processed 
differently in the data flow via Conditional split.
The third sql gets the columns used in the Primary Key

Code by: Renee Poore
  

*******************************************************************************************************
*/

SELECT tblinfo.TABLE_NAME,
       tblinfo.TABLE_SCHEMA,
       ISNULL(tblid.COLUMN_NAME, 'NA') UNIQUE_ID,
       CAST(mop.ORDINAL_POSITION as varchar(1) ) as ORDINAL_POSITION
FROM   (SELECT TABLE_NAME,
               TABLE_SCHEMA
        FROM   INFORMATION_SCHEMA.TABLES
        WHERE
         TABLE_TYPE = 'BASE TABLE'
         AND TABLE_SCHEMA = 'CURAPD01') tblinfo
       LEFT OUTER JOIN (SELECT TABLE_NAME,
                               MAX(ORDINAL_POSITION) AS ORDINAL_POSITION
                        FROM   INFORMATION_SCHEMA.KEY_COLUMN_USAGE
                        WHERE
                         OBJECTPROPERTY(OBJECT_ID(CONSTRAINT_SCHEMA + '.'
                                                  + QUOTENAME(CONSTRAINT_NAME)), 'IsPrimaryKey') = 1
                        GROUP  BY TABLE_NAME) mop
                    ON tblinfo.TABLE_NAME = mop.TABLE_NAME

       INNER JOIN (SELECT DISTINCT TABLE_NAME,
                                   COLUMN_NAME,
                                   ORDINAL_POSITION
                   FROM   INFORMATION_SCHEMA.KEY_COLUMN_USAGE
                   WHERE
                    OBJECTPROPERTY(OBJECT_ID(CONSTRAINT_SCHEMA + '.'
                                             + QUOTENAME(CONSTRAINT_NAME)), 'IsPrimaryKey') = 1) tblid
               ON mop.TABLE_NAME = tblid.TABLE_NAME
                  AND mop.ORDINAL_POSITION = tblid.ORDINAL_POSITION 


				  where tblinfo.TABLE_NAME in ('ADDRESS','CODETABLEITEM')
